titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ernest Gustave Lemcke Manuscript MC.115
titlestmt.author: Stacey Flatt

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-08-11 19:53:40 UTC.

physdesc.extent: in 1 folder in a shared half manuscript box.

did.abstract: Ernest Gustave Lemcke (1877-1964) was an historian, author, and book publisher. The Ernest Gustave Lemcke Manuscript consists of Lemcke's handwritten manuscript on the early history of England, written between approximately 1904 and 1964.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated in February 1992. The accession number associated with this accession is 92.013.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ernest Gustave Lemcke, (1877-1964) was an historian, author, and book publisher. He graduated from Columbia University in 1898. He co-owned Lemcke & Buechner, a book publisher, seller, and importer in New York City, circa early 1900s to 1964.

Sources:
Online copy of book Columbia University in the City of New York: General Catalogue, 1784-1912, Burr Printing House, New York, 1912
The Ernest G. Lemcke Collection (MS 141) at the University of New Hampshire, https://library.unh.edu/find/archives/collections/ernest-g-lemcke-1877 Viewed on 7/29/2025.
"Ernest G. Lemcke" The New York Times, May 2, 1964, https://www.nytimes.com/1964/05/02/archives/article-1-no-title-106964904.html Viewed on July 29, 2025.
Lemcke, Ernest Gustav. The Tribal Hidage, or, First English Census, [192-?]. The New-York Historical Society

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The accession record notes: "Handwritten history of early England written in a small ledger. Unable to find Lemcke in either faculty or student roles for the period, however, the inside cover contains inscription: 'Gift to NYU Library, if wanted, if not, throw'".
It is unclear whether Lemcke donated the ledger to NYU before the 1992 accession date (he died in 1964). The donor remains unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Ernest Gustave Lemcke Manuscript; MC 115; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2025 are unknown. In 2025 the ledger was placed in a legal-sized folder, and also required notes and fields in the resource record were completed or created.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Ernest G. Lemcke Collection (MS 141) at the University of New Hampshire Library, https://library.unh.edu/find/archives/collections/ernest-g-lemcke-1877 Viewed on 7/29/2025.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a 1904 ledger which had been repurposed as a notebook containing Lemcke's handwritten manuscript on an early history of England, written circa 1904-1964.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
